news_header: A report estimates that green investment projects could boost Finland's GDP by €3 billion annually if 20% of planned projects are realized.
news_text: The report commissioned by the Confederation of Finnish Industries (EK) and conducted by consulting firm Gaia calculates that Finland's GDP could increase by €3 billion annually if 20% of the proposed green investment projects are implemented. Based on EK's list of over €270 billion in green transition investments, only €14 billion are currently in production, with many projects still in early planning stages. If about 20% of these projects, amounting to €58 billion in investments, progress to production over the next 30 years, Finland's GDP would rise by approximately 1%. Additionally, employment could improve by 12,000 person-years annually, with 40% from the investment phase and 60% from production. The report also forecasts increases in tax revenues, including €170 million from income taxes, €40 million from corporate taxes, and €330 million from property taxes each year. EK emphasizes the need for high-value-added supply chains and the synchronized advancement of interdependent investments.
